definitions: shake with slight rapid movements often from cold fear or emotion
examples: Her voice began to quiver with emotion during the speech
The leaves quivered in the gentle morning breeze

definitions: cause severe and extensive damage or destruction to something or someone
examples: The hurricane ravaged the coastal towns last year
Disease ravaged the crops leaving farmers with nothing

definitions: rescue or save something from loss destruction or waste for further use
examples: Divers worked to salvage treasure from the sunken ship
She tried to salvage her reputation after the scandal

definitions: torment or tease someone with the sight or promise of something unobtainable
examples: The smell of baking bread tantalized the hungry children
Job offers from overseas tantalized him for months

definitions: pull apart threads or fibers causing something woven to come undone
solve or explain something complicated or mysterious by investigating carefully
examples: The sweater began to unravel at the sleeve
One pulled thread caused the fabric to unravel completely
Detectives worked to unravel the complex conspiracy
Scientists hope to unravel the mysteries of the universe

definitions: speak or write about someone in an abusively negative way damaging reputation
examples: The press continued to vilify the politician
Don't vilify someone based on rumors alone

definitions: hold and use a weapon tool or power with control and skill
examples: The knight learned to wield a sword expertly
She wielded considerable influence in the company

definitions: leave hurriedly and secretly typically to avoid detection or arrest
examples: The treasurer absconded with company funds
The suspect absconded before police could arrive

definitions: wave or flourish a weapon or object in a threatening or excited manner
examples: The robber brandished a knife during the holdup
Protesters brandished signs and banners in the square

definitions: cease to resist an opponent or demand surrendering under agreed conditions
examples: The army was forced to capitulate after the siege
She refused to capitulate to their unreasonable demands

definitions: make someone or something weak reducing strength health or energy severely
examples: The illness debilitated him for several months
Constant stress can debilitate your immune system

definitions: make something more attractive by adding decorative details or features
add extra details to a story making it more interesting but less truthful
examples: She embellished the dress with colorful beads
The artist embellished the frame with gold leaf
He tends to embellish his fishing stories
Don't embellish the truth when giving testimony

definitions: invent or create false information stories or evidence to deceive
construct or manufacture something from various parts or materials
examples: The witness fabricated the entire story about the accident
Someone fabricated these documents to frame him
The company fabricates steel beams for construction
Workers fabricate custom parts in the machine shop

definitions: engage in close physical fight wrestling or struggling with someone
struggle mentally to deal with or understand a difficult problem
examples: The wrestlers grappled on the mat for position
Security guards grappled with the intruder
Students grapple with complex mathematical concepts
The company continues to grapple with declining sales

definitions: hinder or impede movement or progress by creating obstacles or restrictions
examples: Heavy rain hampered rescue efforts in the mountains
Don't let negative thoughts hamper your success

definitions: put something completely into liquid so it is totally covered
involve oneself deeply in an activity or interest with full attention
examples: Immerse the vegetables in cold water before cooking
The priest immersed the baby during baptism
She immersed herself in studying Japanese culture
He became immersed in writing his first novel

definitions: place two or more things close together to compare or contrast them
examples: The artist juxtaposed bright colors with dark shadows
The essay juxtaposes urban and rural lifestyles effectively

definitions: suffer from being forced to remain in unpleasant situation without attention
grow weak or feeble losing vitality strength or energy gradually
examples: Prisoners languished in terrible conditions for years
The project languished without proper funding
Plants languish without adequate water and sunlight
He languished in bed recovering from the illness

definitions: make something bad less severe serious or painful through action
examples: Insurance helps mitigate financial losses from accidents
Trees mitigate air pollution in urban areas

definitions: make a legal decision contract or agreement no longer valid
make something have no effect or value canceling its impact
examples: The court nullified the marriage due to fraud
Parliament voted to nullify the controversial law
One mistake could nullify all our hard work
The new evidence nullifies their main argument

definitions: exclude someone from a society or group refusing to associate with them
examples: The community ostracized him after the scandal
Children sometimes ostracize classmates who seem different

definitions: make something continue indefinitely especially something negative or harmful
examples: These outdated policies perpetuate inequality in society
Don't perpetuate harmful stereotypes through your actions

definitions: put an end to rebellion or disorder using force or authority
examples: Police arrived to quell the riot downtown
The manager tried to quell rumors about layoffs

definitions: fill something up again after it has been emptied or reduced
examples: Remember to replenish the water bottles before hiking
The store needs to replenish its inventory weekly

definitions: waste money time or opportunity in a reckless foolish manner
examples: He squandered his inheritance on gambling
Don't squander this chance to study abroad

definitions: prevent someone from accomplishing something by opposing or blocking their efforts
examples: Bad weather thwarted our plans for a picnic
Security measures thwarted the attempted robbery

definitions: take a position of power or importance illegally or by force

examples: The general tried to usurp power from the government
No one can usurp your rightful place in the family

definitions: alternate or waver between different opinions or actions showing indecision
examples: She vacillated between accepting and rejecting the offer
Don't vacillate when making important life decisions

definitions: roll around or lie relaxed in water mud or snow
indulge in an emotion or situation without trying to improve
examples: Pigs love to wallow in cool mud
Hippos wallow in the river during hot days
Stop wallowing in self pity and take action
He wallowed in luxury at the expensive resort

definitions: combine or unite to form one organization structure or whole entity
examples: The two companies decided to amalgamate their resources
Several small schools amalgamated into one large campus

definitions: leave property or money to someone in a will after death
examples: She bequeathed her jewelry collection to her daughter
The millionaire bequeathed his fortune to charity

definitions: find a way around an obstacle rule or problem using clever means
examples: Hackers try to circumvent security systems
They circumvented the law through legal loopholes

definitions: spread information knowledge or ideas widely to many people or places
examples: Social media helps disseminate news instantly worldwide
Teachers disseminate knowledge to their students daily

definitions: make a problem bad situation or negative feeling worse than before
examples: Arguing will only exacerbate the tension between them
Hot weather exacerbates the drought conditions

definitions: display something ostentatiously to provoke envy or admiration from others
examples: She likes to flaunt her expensive jewelry
Don't flaunt your wealth in front of others

definitions: begin to grow and put forth shoots after a period of dormancy
examples: Seeds germinate when given water warmth and light
These beans should germinate within seven days

definitions: be a sign that something is going to happen soon
examples: Dark clouds harbinger an approaching storm
Economic indicators harbinger a possible recession

definitions: suggest or hint something bad in an indirect unpleasant way
move oneself slowly into a position of favor or advantage
examples: Are you trying to insinuate that I'm lying
She insinuated that he got the job unfairly
He managed to insinuate himself into their group
The cat insinuated itself between us on the couch

definitions: put someone or something into a dangerous position risking harm or loss
examples: Don't jeopardize your health by skipping meals
One mistake could jeopardize the entire mission

definitions: start a fire by lighting wood paper or other combustible material
arouse or inspire an emotion interest or passionate feeling in someone
examples: Use dry twigs to kindle the campfire quickly
She kindled a small fire to warm the cabin
The speech kindled hope in their hearts
His smile kindled feelings she thought were gone

definitions: convert assets into cash by selling them usually quickly
close a business and sell its assets to pay debts
examples: They had to liquidate investments to pay bills
The collector liquidated his rare stamp collection
The company was forced to liquidate after bankruptcy
Creditors demanded they liquidate all remaining stock

definitions: speak about someone in a spitefully critical way spreading harmful untruths
examples: The article maligned her character without evidence
Political opponents often malign each other publicly

definitions: make something ineffective by canceling out its effect or value
deny the truth or existence of something stating it is false
examples: This new evidence negates our previous theory
Poor execution negated all their careful planning
He tried to negate the accusations against him
You cannot simply negate established scientific facts

definitions: move in a slanting direction not straight or perpendicular
examples: The path obliques through the forest avoiding obstacles
Sunlight obliqued through the window at sunset

definitions: spread throughout something penetrating into every part or aspect of it
examples: The smell of coffee permeated the entire office
Joy permeated the atmosphere at the wedding celebration

definitions: reject or void a decision legally especially by judicial action
put an end to or suppress something forcefully and completely
examples: The appeals court quashed the conviction
The judge quashed the subpoena
The government moved quickly to quash the rebellion
Management tried to quash rumors of layoffs

definitions: assign to a lower position rank or condition reducing importance or status
examples: The team was relegated to a lower division
Don't relegate important tasks to the last minute

definitions: provide evidence to support or prove the truth of a claim or statement
examples: You need to substantiate your claims with facts
The audit will substantiate our financial reports
